cilium completion bash 
 Generate the autocompletion script for bash 
 Synopsis 
 Generate the autocompletion script for the bash shell. 
 This script depends on the 'bash-completion' package.
If it is not installed already, you can install it via your OS's package manager. 
 To load completions in your current shell session: 
 source <(cilium completion bash)
 
 To load completions for every new session, execute once: 
 Linux: 
 cilium completion bash > /etc/bash_completion.d/cilium
 
 macOS: 
 cilium completion bash > $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion.d/cilium
 
 You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect. 
 cilium completion bash
 
 Options 
   -h, --help              help for bash
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions
 
 Options inherited from parent commands 
       --as string                  Username to impersonate for the operation. User could be a regular user or a service account in a namespace.
      --as-group stringArray       Group to impersonate for the operation, this flag can be repeated to specify multiple groups.
      --context string             Kubernetes configuration context
      --helm-release-name string   Helm release name (default "cilium")
      --kubeconfig string          Path to the kubeconfig file
  -n, --namespace string           Namespace Cilium is running in (default "kube-system")
 
 SEE ALSO 
 
 cilium completion 	 - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell
